005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.IFeatureValueConstrained;
009
010import java.util.Locale;
011
012import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
016
017public interface IDefinition extends INamedModelElement, IAttributable, IFeatureValueConstrained {
018  /**
019   * Describes the visibility of a definition to other modules.
020   */
021  enum ModuleScope {
022    /**
023     * The definition is scoped to only the defining module.
024     */
025    PRIVATE,
026    /**
027     * The definition is scoped to its defining module and any importing module.
028     */
029    PUBLIC;
030  }
031
032  @NonNull
033  ModuleScope DEFAULT_MODULE_SCOPE = ModuleScope.PUBLIC;
034
035  /**
036   * Retrieve the definition's scope within the context of its defining module.
037   *
038   * @return the module scope
039   */
040  @NonNull
041  default ModuleScope getModuleScope() {
042    return ModuleScope.PRIVATE;
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * The qualified name for the definition.
047   * <p>
048   * This name is the combination of the definition's namespace, which is the
049   * module's namespace, and the definition's name.
050   *
051   * @return the definition's qualified name
052   */
053  @NonNull
054  default QName getDefinitionQName() {
055    return new QName(
056        getContainingModule().getXmlNamespace().toASCIIString(),
057        getName());
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Determine if the definition is defined inline, meaning the definition is
062   * declared where it is used.
063   * <p>
064   * If this method returns {@code false}, then {@link #getInlineInstance()} must
065   * return {@code null}.
066   *
067   * @return {@code true} if the definition is declared inline or {@code false} if
068   *         the definition is able to be globally referenced
069   * @see #getInlineInstance()
070   */
071  default boolean isInline() {
072    return getInlineInstance() != null;
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * If {@link #isInline()} is {@code true}, return the instance the definition is
077   * inlined for.
078   * <p>
079   * If this method returns {@code null}, then {@link #getInlineInstance()} must
080   * return {@code false}.
081   *
082   * @return the instance or {@code null} otherwise
083   * @see #isInline()
084   */
085  INamedInstance getInlineInstance();
086
087  /**
088   * Generates a coordinate string for the provided information element
089   * definition.
090   *
091   * A coordinate consists of the element's:
092   * <ul>
093   * <li>containing Metaschema's short name</li>
094   * <li>model type</li>
095   * <li>name</li>
096   * <li>hash code</li>
097   * </ul>
098   *
099   * @return the coordinate
100   */
101  @SuppressWarnings("null")
102  @Override
103  default String toCoordinates() {
104    return String.format("%s:%s-definition:%s(%d)",
105        getContainingModule().getShortName(),
106        getModelType().toString().toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT),
107        getName(),
108        hashCode());
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Get the resource location information for the provided item, if known.
113   *
114   * @param itemValue
115   *          the item to get the location information for
116   *
117   * @return the resource location information, or {@code null} if not known
118   */
119  @Nullable
120  default IResourceLocation getLocation(@NonNull Object itemValue) {
121    return itemValue instanceof IBoundObject ? ((IBoundObject) itemValue).getMetaschemaData() : null;
122  }
123}
